Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Michael Finley and Steve Nash each scored 33 points as the Dallas Mavericks beat the Milwaukee Bucks 113-101 Thursday night for their season-high fifth straight victory.
article.headline: Finley, Nash each score 33 to power Mavs

images.name: Nash, Steve 011220 inline
images.caption: Steve Nash scored 33 points and had eight assists to lead the Mavs.

article.linkText: Mavs shoot down Bucks for fifth straight win
article.story:
DALLAS (AP) -- Steve Nash and Michael Finley more than made up for Dirk Nowitzki's poor shooting. Nash and Finley each had 33 points and eight assists as the Dallas Mavericks beat the Milwaukee Bucks 113-101 Thursday night for their season-high fifth straight victory. Tim Hardaway added 15 points, and Juwan Howard 13 for the Mavericks, who won despite only eight points and 3-for-14 field goal shooting from Nowitzki. Nash forced the tempo and got his team into its running game, which helped Dallas shoot 51.7 percent from the field. "I thought Steve was their catalyst tonight," Milwaukee guard Ray Allen said. "He's so unselfish, and it's contagious with his teammates. He passes the ball in transition and gets his teammates open looks." Nowitzki, who started the night with a 23.3 scoring average, did lead Dallas with 12 rebounds. "It's been like that all year," Hardaway said. "One of our big three always seems to have a big game, and when one doesn't, the others seem to pick it up." Nash went 12-for-18 from the field, including 5-for-8 from 3-point range. Finley hit 16 of his 31 field goal attempts. Allen and Glenn Robinson both scored 21 points, and Michael Redd added 16 for the Bucks, whose three-game winning streak ended. Finley and Nash took over after halftime, combining for 26 of Dallas' 28 third-quarter points as the Mavericks built an 87-75 lead entering the final quarter. "We got in a rhythm in the third quarter," Nash said. "It makes it easy on the team when you get hot from the perimeter." The Mavericks held a 70-67 lead with 6:51 left in the third quarter, then took control with a 17-8 run over the final six minutes of the period. "Steve had it going in the third quarter," Finley said. "I didn't think he was ever going to miss. For the most part he carried us, and then I was able to make some shots." Nash triggered the decisive run with a 3-pointer and had nine of the 17 points. Finley had six, and Howard added two free throws. "Nash did a great job," Milwaukee coach George Karl said. "He had total control of the game." Allen and Robinson were a combined 16-for-44 from the field. Sam Cassell scored 12 points, seven under his average. "We never really got our big three involved," Karl said. "They're talented All-Stars but right now we haven't meshed as well as Dallas is meshing." Dallas led 59-53 at halftime, behind Finley's 14 points and Nash's 13.

Game notes
Danny Manning started at center for the Mavericks after sitting out three of the previous four games. ... The Bucks had won five of their previous six. ... Dallas is 13-0 this season when it scores 100 or more points. ... Milwaukee had won eight of its previous nine games against Dallas.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
